org.cripac.isee.vpe.ctrl

Class SystemPropertyCenter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cripac.isee.vpe.ctrl.SystemPropertyCenter

  • public class SystemPropertyCenter
extends java.lang.Object
    The SystemPropertyCenter class is responsible of managing the properties of the systems. There are some properties predefined, and they can be overwritten by command options or an extern property file. It can also generate back command options for uses like SparkSubmit.
    Author:
    Ken Yu, CRIPAC, 2016

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SystemPropertyCenter.NoAppSpecifiedException
      Thrown when no application is specified in any possible property sources.

      • sysPropFilePath

        public java.lang.String sysPropFilePath

      • appPropFilePath

        public java.lang.String appPropFilePath
        Application-specific property file. Properties loaded from it will override those loaded from the system property file. Leaving it as null will let the system automatically find that in default places according to the application specified.

        public java.lang.String sparkConfFilePath

    • Method Detail

      • getArgs

        public java.lang.String[] getArgs()
                           throws SystemPropertyCenter.NoAppSpecifiedException
        Generate command line options for SparkSubmit client, according to the stored properties.
        Returns:
        An array of string with format required by SparkSubmit client.
        Throws:
        SystemPropertyCenter.NoAppSpecifiedException - When no application is specified to run.
